definition: to strip/to deprive of/to discharge/to dismiss/to undress
to seize/to take away forcibly/to wrest control of/to compete or strive for/to force one's way through/to leave out/to lose

sentences.english: One attaints physical radiance and inner wisdom is increased.
sentences.chinese: 一宣告褫夺私权身体的光辉，而且内部的智慧被增加。

sentences.english: He had to quit the position and went in exile, having been deprived of his power.
sentences.chinese: 他被褫夺了权力之后，只好离职，漂泊异乡。

sentences.english: She had so much, earth could not claim the whole.
sentences.chinese: 她拥有丰沛，地狱也无法刹那褫夺她整个生命。

definition: to dismiss from office/to ban/to reject
to sack/to remove from a position/to depose
to remove sb from their post/to dismiss
to deprive/to expropriate/to strip (sb of his property)
an execution/to put sb to death
to imprison/to place under house arrest
to warn/to blame/to rebuke/also written 申斥
